text: Fresh fruity beer: citrus, grapefruit, touch of peach. Hoppy bitter, but not too much. A bit watery. Not very spectacular, but a decent beer.
UPDATED: JUN 7, 2017 Cask at Euston Tap. Sweaty lemon hops aroma. Fresh lemon zest and grassy cereal undertones. Ideal summer beer.

Draught at WilliamK Kurvi. Hazy amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, earthy notes, malts, mango and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, mango, resin, ripe rruits and grass. Very nice blonde ale.

Can from the Old Bicycle Shop, Cambridge. Light gold, hazy with a white film for a head. Light resinous aroma with citrus and banana notes. Surprisingly sweet taste: theres a touch of a hoppy bitterness but for the most part its gentle, honeyed and refreshing. Lightly carbonated. Its not a knock your socks off beer, but its well-balanced and a pleasant joy to sip.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Ciasteczkowa słodowość, kwiatowo-ziołowe chmiele, mało ciała, rześkie, pijalne.

Cask at St Albans Beer Shop, St Albans, UK. Colour is pale hazy yellow, with a big white head. Aroma is citrus, floral, honey, light hoppy. Taste is fresh, light sweet with decent bitterness. Body is light, carbonation is fine. Finish is lemon, grapefruit and with decent bitterness. Very easy drinking. You can drink this all night. Overall good for me!
Can 33cl. Pour a golden beer with a small rapidly fading white head. Hoppy nose and mouth lightly bitter. Refreshing beer. 04/17

Can from Hops and Crafts Exeter. Pours hazy lemon with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruit,pineapple,papaya,tangerine passionfruit, lemon & some pine . Taste of tangerine,orange rind,lemon,pine & crackerlike biscuit. Light bodied & well carbonated. The finish is bitter & dry with more hop flavours of tangerine,orange zest & crackerlike biscuit . A great session beer!
Ocena przepisana z notatek / innego serwisu w ramach uzupełniania profilu na RateBeer. Solidnie nachmielone, świeże, rześkie i owocowe z naciskiem na cytrusy.
Pint from keg at the Pint Shop (Cambridge). Beautiful citrus-y beer, great aroma and taste, and remarkable after-taste.

Palish golden light haze. Med intense floral, light meadowy fruity sweetness on nose. With citrus, light currants. Lightish bodied, nice balance, kinda honey sweetness, somewhat thin. Ok, refreshing pale ale. Dont think ill remember it tomorrow tho-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

330ml can into pint glass. Cloudy amber beer with solid two finger white head. Laces well. Hard to see, but many tiny bubbles exist within. Nose is barnyard, grass, socks. overripe fruit, honey. Light body, refreshing. Finish is weak fruit cordial with a bitter herbal chalkiness. Fantastic beer, really interesting.

Boks kjøpt på Gulating Tromsø. Aroma aprikos, humle, malt. Utseende lett tåkete gylden med hvitt skum. Smak sitrus, humle, grapefrukt, malt. Godt balansert med endel bitterhet og fylde. Rund og god øl

---

Pours a golden-hay yellow, vey minimal head and no real apparent carbonation. Aroma is of juicy hops. Taste is refreshing hop and some grass and light grains/malts followed by decent bittering. Decent.

0,33l can at home bought from BeerGonzo. BB 01/2018. yellow quite hazy color, small white head. smells of pines, exotic fruits, light tobacco, light peach, lemon grassy, lovely smell especially considering the ABV. light body, soft carbonation, light mouthfeel. tastes earthy, rather obvious malts, some lemon grass, overall rather grassy, tobacco, light grains. finishes medium bitter with notes of grains, tobacco and some lemon grass. quite nice one, taste lacks behind the lovely smell though. overall still rather enjoyable.
Tap @ Luppolo 12, Roma. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are fruits, grass, straw, hops and malt. Very nice!

Shared can at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Moor Night presentation. Pale golden colour, moderate white head. Aroma of Citra hops, hints of spruce. Pine and grapefruit in the flavour, fairly dry. The mouthfeel is a bit thin.
Shared can at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy light amber with white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits. Tastes slightly bitter. Thin bodied, bitter finish. Refreshing.

Can at home from Clapton Craft, Kentish Town on 14th February 2017. Sweet fragrant citric aroma. Delicate floral and fine citrus hoppiness in-mouth with sweet malts. A tangy citrus finish of shortish duration. Light body and a zingy mouthfeel.

Ljusgul, disig. Fräsch fruktig doft med citrus, grape och lite söta tropiska frukter. Även smaken är fräscht fruktig med mer citrus än tropiskt, rätt tunn men mycket fräsch och läskande, bra för att var 4,1 %.
Provning på De Klomp.
Dancing Man, Southampton. Pineapple. Pleasant soft tropical fruit. A little lacking in the malt department. OK.
On tap @ BBB. Cloudy golden with a small white head. Malty and fruity. Malt, fruit and hops. Medium body with a nice bitter/ sweet.

Gravity Cask Half Pint at GBBF 2011 (Day 2), Earls Court, London Aug 2011 - as "Moor Northern Star" - Ultra-pale ale. Hoppy; floral and grassy hops. Fruity; grapefruit citrus and tropical fruit, honey and elderflower. Malty; biscuity malts. Very refreshing. Nice citrus hop bite. Good beer! (2011-08-03)

Lovely fresh hop aroma. Can conditioned but poured with very little sediment. Slightly hazy appearance. Very quaffable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can at Café Derat, Utrecht. Aroma is citrussy tropical fruity hops and soft grainy malt. Flavour is light sweet and moderate bitter with a dry finish. Body is light. Refreshing easy sessionable hoppy pale ale.

Cloudy yellow, decent head, lacing and medium carbonation. Took me by surprise this is an American style IPA with a tropical nose consisting of pineapple, elderflower, orange and blossom. The taste is slightly dry with a citrus finish, mango, green leaves and slight grapefruit taste. Very drinkable, will try Moor again. Price Paid: £2.40 (330ml can)
Impresionante en su fase preliminar mas posee qualqunos detalles colorificos que no me tocan enhiesto

Giallo limone opalescente con schiuma fine bianca dalla lunga persistenza. Al naso lime e scorza di pompelmo. In bocca carica di agrumi:ancora lime e polpa darancia. Corpo leggero e carbonazione nella media. Buono lamaro. Sessionable eccellente.

Aroma; fresh spruce, resin, lemon, tropic malts, freshness. Look; off white head, misty pale golden body. Taste; bread, resin, spruce, lemon, caramel malts - lemony malted finish. Feel; good, smooth, easy. Overall; very good brew. From the tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours golden, with medium white fine foam, leaving quite a residue on the glass. Aroma is not intense, but pleasant, of herbs, cheese, bread, a little citrus. Body is light and flat. Taste is predominantly bitter, not still moderate. Finish is very short.

Boks 330ml kjøpt på Tuckers Maltings, Newton Abbot. Delt med Rune på tog mellom Exeter og London 30 Sep 16. Lys gulbrun. Uklar. Filmskum. Lett ferskenaroma. Smaken syrlige plommer. Lett tørr etter hvert.

Lukt: Sursøtlige frukter.
Utseende: Gul.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum.
Smak: Citrus, sursøtlige frukter.
Hvor: Tasting kveld hos Bryne med Untapd Kristian.

33cl can from ales by mail. Light hazy gold color. Thin white head. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Medium body. Carbonation is soft. Aroma is pineapple, hops, light citric, tea flowers. Super easy drinkable.
Smell a little yeasty, sour like lemon peel. Taste is lovely, crisp grassy malty lovely hops, a bit zesty and not floral

Can. Hazy golden with a medium sized white head with good retention and lace. Citrus, honey, green plants and white bread in the nose. The flavour is try with green plants, hay, grass, citrus, flowers and white bread. Light body, oily texture, soft carbonation, light sweet and medium bitter. Dry and bitter finish.

Aroma of malt, tropical fruits, citrus and grass. Hazy golden with a white head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with a average carbonation. Overall a very plesant Golden Ale. Refreshing and quite easy to drink.

Canned, 330 ml from Gradi Plato - Piazza Epiro, Rome. Pours clear orange with small white head. Nice fruity, hoppy, citrus aroma. Sweetish, citrus, moderate bitter finish. Medium bodied. Expected a bit more from flavor.
Great amount od character for the abv grape citrus hazy gold with good head and lacing.
1/2 pint on tap @ One Pint Pub. Pours cloudy yellow with a low head. Aroma is malts with fresh fruits. Flavor is fruity malts with some hops. Light but well balanced. Good.

Draught @Olutexpo 2016. 
Poured golden color with a thin white head. 
Grapefruity, floral, hoppy aroma. Citrus juice as well. 
Pretty much citrus, kiwi, hops and fruits. Light and crisp.
On tap at Örebro Ölcafé (old rating). Light hoppy and bready smell. Similar taste with a flowery aroma. Mild overall. Smooth and easy to drink.

1.5dl on tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam, Moor tap takeover. Nose is lemonade. Body is slightly opalescent yellow, head is medium, white, creamy, average lasting, good lacing. Aroma is citrus, honey, tropical fruits, lemonade. Medium sweet, light bitter, light citric sour. Finish is medium lasting hoppy medium bitter, further developing hoppy bitterness. Light body, dry texture, soft coronation. Easy, refreshing summer beer, tasty, nice one.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus, 4.1%. Hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, little citrus and grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, grapefruit, little sweet, little dry, little floral, little grass and medium bitter.

0,33L can bought at the Bottle Shop Hong Kong.
Appearance: Pours a hazy golden to orange colour with soapy medium to tall white head. Some yeast particles at the bottom of the glass.
Aroma: Some lychee, honey, straw, pine needles, with some grassy and herbal aroma.
Taste: Some sweet honey and malt sweetness, mild grassy and strawy bitterness. Some citrus and with some yeast taste.
Palate: Light to medium body with a very smooth texture. Dry finish with mild grassy a bitterness and malt and honey sweetness
Overall: Lovely golden ale, very light and easy going but has managed to sustain its character, especially that honey and malt sweetness, and its smooth texture. A really promising ale.
Can 33cl from AbM. Pours pale golden, small white head. Fruity, jucy, elderflower, herbal aroma. Light, fruity, dry, herbal flavor.

Butelka z datą: SEP.2016
AROMAT: Intensywny. Żółte owoce, cytrusy. W tle bardzo subtelna nuta karmelowo-ziołowo-miodowa "na sposób belgijski".
WYGLĄD: Barwa jasnozłota, zamglone. Piana drobna, średniej wysokości.
SMAK: Cytrusy, nuta ziołowa, słody. Ekstremalnie pijalne. Goryczka średnia do niskiej, krótka. 
OGÓLNIE: Lekkie, orzeźwiające, minimalistyczne, dobre.

Smell of honey, hops, fruit. Hazy golden colour, very high white head. Aroma of fruit, dry hops, grass. Some honey in finish. Very dry palate, very light body, very flat carbon. One of the smoothest ales Ive had. Extremely light, yet not watery. Very nice.

Can from Sourced Market St Pancras, BBE June 2017, large sample. Hazy golden color, medium frothy head. Aroma of piney hops, slight grassy, bit tropical fruit, slight grainy malt. Medium bitterness, bit citrussy fruit. Lovely session IPA.

Is this the APA Ive been looking for? Nice bright flavor, citrusy, clean with a light finish. Very drinkable, noticeably hoppy. This is a solid and well balanced beer in my opinion, Id definitely buy it when I see it.

Can from Connollys Wines, Solihull. poured a hazy light amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is yeast and bags of citrus hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a light, fruity, light woody hop bitter, light floral palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. No bubbles here, just bags of fruit!
Can from Rayneville Superstore, Armley, Leeds. Very hoppy aroma, full of deep flavour, I got some Malt but overall very hoppy. Great taste though and cant believe its only 4.1%. Very sessionable.

Holiday, top-50 fun hunt. #-5, quick notes, from can 33cl, 4.1%, hazy yellow/golden with a white head. Aroma of citus, straw, grass, hay, malt. Taste is quite soft bitter however lasts long, straw, grass, fresh, nice hoppy fresh pale ale, this one is a couple of weeks old, nice

330 ml can bought at Great Food Hall in Pacific Place, Admiralty.
Looks: Translucent golden honey colour with a cloud of misty yeast particles; Two finger head with crumpety white foam which lasts for 4 minutes; Beautiful sticky lacing and very slight carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant Ale malt, with strong passion fruits, canned peaches, pineapples, honey, strong floral, sugar, bread, strong yeast, lemon and light grass.

Taste: Close to light sweet Ale malt, with wheaty tartness, light grapefruits, citrus, yellow fruits, floral, light molasses, biscuits, strong yeast, light lemon, fair bitter hops and grass.

Body: Mid to light body. Thin but creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: Solid maltyness in a slightly watery yet very smooth background with notable wheaty tartness. Low-fi grapefruit and citrus echo the floral and pretty light sweetness. Yeasty with light lemon to round. Light and refreshing!

Hoppiness: Strong passion fruits, canned peaches, pineapples, strong floral, lemon and light grass in nose. Light grapefruits, citrus, yellow fruits, floral, light lemon and grass in taste; Bitterness is close to medium for a lasting, fairly astringent grassy finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Smooth and light bitter to mouth.

Comments: This is pretty much in the mould of Session IPA with very nice tropical fruity aroma, yet taste is light touch of malt and hops with smooth palate and relaxing impression on all fronts. Pretty well-made already but stronger hop taste and variety will be ever better. Easy going chill-out material!

Dorata, lievemente velata, schiuma molto sottile. Al naso sentori erbacei, fruttati ed agrumati. Carbonazione elevata. Leggera, floreale. Note agrumate, pompelmo. Malto nascosto a favore di una discreta amarezza, specie sul finale.
330ml can. Clear, light golden with a foamy white head. Big citrus aroma, light, floral citrus flavour. Very refreshing.

Cask @ The Slaughtered Lamb, Clerkenwell, London. Amber-orange with a thin bubbly head. Has a dominant tropical fruitiness despite a slightly thin tasting texture, this includes citrus orange. Has a fair amount of fruit in its nose.

How: Draught.
Where: Oliver Twist, Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Grapefruit, hops, citrus, caramel.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Grapefruit, citrus, caramel, a bit floral.

330ml can from Favourite Beers. Hazy pale orange colour with a small white head. Aroma is hoppy, floral, elderflower, citrus. Taste is also hoppy and quite floral, citrus, bit of grapefruit, decent bitterness. Oily in texture, soft carbonation. Very sessionable.

330ml can. Pours a very hazy light gold. Inviting nose with fruity notes, boiled fruit sweets and sherbet. Also some grapefruit. Very little of the nose follows through into the taste. Its all a bit washed out and nondescript. Very light malt and hop presence and it all feels a bit watery. Reasonably bitter finish, light body and medium carbonation. Promised a lot more than it delivered.

Canned. Pours hazy golden with an average, lacing white head. Aroma of citrus, flowery notes and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and pleasant bitter. Medium bodied, watery to oily textureand average carbonatiion. A smooth, crisp and very nice Ale 🌟🌟🌟🌟
Cloudy light golden, white head. Juicy passionfruit, pineapple and pine aroma. Similar flavour, crisp with good malt support. Very nice.

Cask conditioned @Beer Emporium, Bristol.
Small head, yellow colour, hazy, good lacing. Citrusy aroma: grapefruit, lemon. Light body, lightly bitter with bitter/sweet aftertaste.
Pale yellow colour, white head. Aroma of lemon, orange, a bit of poneapple. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, citrusy flavour. Very easy to drink. Light body, slick texture, soft carbonation.

Can at Oliver Twist. Hazy golden with creamy white head. Very fruity hop aroma with lychee, grapefruit and some honey. Citrus and lychee also in the taste with some grassy and floral notes. Well balanced and highly thirst quenching. Thin and crisp mouthfeel and lightly hoppy finish, very nice one!

Can. Pale hazy yellow with a thin white head. Wow smells amazing - grapefruit, lemon and pineapple rock. Favour is restrained compared to the smell and up front its feels really watery and washed out. There is a nice bitterness that lingers on but honestly it starts out tasting totally blank almost like there is totally no flavour. Wasnt expecting a powerpunching beer here, the smell got my hopes up but in the end a real let down.
Tap paf. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of hops, grape, citrus, malty, light soapt, grassy. Taste is rather sweet, quite bitter. Dry and bitter finish.

330ml can. Golden colour, white foam head leaving lacing and fruity hop aroma. Taste is pale malt, juicy, zesty & fruity with citrusy hop bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, light bodied, soft carbonation, dry fruity finish. Quite drinkable.

33ml Can. Piwo swietnie pacnnie cytryna i limonka i niedojzala pomarancza. Smak gozko wytrawny lekko slodowy, wyrazisty bardzo goryczkowy, typowy dla brytyjskich ale. Wyglad to jaskrawe zolte piwo, mocno mętne z drobinkami paleczek drożdżowych, male wysycenie ale spora piana, średnio trwala. Koncowka dluga i goryczkowa, gdyby nie było by w puszce był bym jeszcze bardziej zadowolony.

Keg at Ångkvarn, Uppsala.  Hazy golden, creamy head. Rich aroma of grapefruit and lychee. Mid dry with medium body and well rounded mouthfeel. Bready, gentle malt supports the big pink grapefruit flavour. Mid bitter finish. Good stuff!
On tap. Lovely golden hue, inviting aroma. Just the right level of hops for me. Minor foam lingers on the surface long after the pour. Really good, will try again.
Citrus and white tropical fruits in taste and aroma. Light bodied, fizzy carbonated, crisp. Finish is bitter. Nice and fruity session beer.
Puszka zakupiona na Warszawski Festiwalu Piwa 0,33l. Kolor złoty, mętny, piana średnia, nic szczególnego. Aromat cytrusów, smak owocowy, orzeźwiający.Wysokie nasycenie z owocową goryczką.

Can, pours gold with a light haze. Aroma is citrus hop, grapefruit, lemon, over honeyed caramel, dry finish with a light yeasty character. Light sweetness and bitterness. Body is light, texture has some oilyness. Carbonation is soft. Very quaffable.
Fra flaske. Den smager af græs og nogle tørre træagtige ting. En rigtig fin øl...

Draught at Oliver Twist Stockholm. Lasting thick white head. Very clowdy golden color. Fresh hoppy aroma with both lemon and grapefruit. The taste is not as big as the aroma with citrus and a balanced bitterness. Thinn body and no sweetness.
33cl can. Pale with a creamy white head. Hoppy and citrusy, grassy. Low sweetness, bitter finish. Soft carbonation, oily palate. Nothing wrong.

On cask at The Old Fountain Pub, London-- Pours cloudy yellow with thin white head. Nose is lychee. Aromas are lychee, tropical fruits, herbal and piney hops. Low carbonation, medium body. Long bitter and lychee finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Beermerchants. Pours almost clear golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of peaches and citrus along with some soft marmelade. Soft and creamy mouthfeel with a lively carbonation level, light dry, crisp and clean weak bitter fruity, very good and refreshing beer.

Puszka 330ml. Kolor żółto / pomarańczowy, mętne. Piana szybko opadająca, przeciętna. Aromat słodkawy, lekka nuta trawy, lekkie cytrusy. Smak bardzo orzeźwiający, cytrusowy, w tle nuta melona. Bardzo dobre, lekkie piwo na lato.

Draught (Bishops Arms, Västerås) - Hazy amber in colour. Pine, biscuity malt and grapefruit in the aroma. Apricot, peach, manadarin, grapefruit and biscuity malt all feature in the hoppy and zesty taste.

Pours a golden yellow with a slight white head. Aroma is earthy, mango, pineapple, floral and slight honey. Taste is medium piney bitter, tropical fruit sweetness, piney, spruce spritz, citrusy zest, resin.

Pours hazy golden yellow with low white head. Aroma of citrus, floral notes, light tropical fruit, hints of honey. Taste is fresh and crisp light pine bitter with a mellow fruit backbone. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.

On tap at OConnors, backlog. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma hoppy; citrus, grapefruit, pine mainly. Taste is medium sweet and hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, pine, resin with a hoppy finish. Light bitterness

Excelente golden Ale con un aroma impresionante a lúpulo fresco, apariencia agradable que refresca sólo con verla.... espuma densa y sabor refrescante, suave y lupulado... Dios! cada día me va más este royo!
Pours Cloudy Golden. Strong Citrus aroma. Fairly light body, very sessionable, simple, but tasty

Lattina, a casa. Colore giallo oro/arancio. Testa alta e soapy, persistente ed in lenta diminuzione. Carbonazione flat. Olfatto di agrumi (arancia e pompelmo) e frutti tropicali (mango e avocado), uva, lontana sensazione di pesca, oltre ad erbe (salvia, menta e luppolo fresco) e fiori maturi. Aroma primariamente citrico fruttato e luppolato, poi maltato (orzo, grano e lievito) in stile inglese. Sensazione palatale piccante, alcolica, di agrumi e luppoli. La discreta luppolatura è molto soddisfacente, gentilmente amara e mossa. Corpo sottile di impostazione session. Tessuto watery, appena oleoso. Pulita ed estremamente scorrevole, con finale di beva maltata dove sparisce del tutto la frutta, fino a pochi istanti prima protagonista. Una buona e freschissima golden pale ale inglese, che strizza locchio alle moderne session ipa, ma nettamente più gentile ed azzimata. Un po trattenuta: avevo ipotizzato una maggiore intensità, soprattutto nel corpo, dato lo stile dichiarato. Comunque promossa.

Cloudy pale orange colored, small+ non lasting white head, nice lacing. Aroma is of some caramalt, floral grassy and citrus hops. Taste is light to medium sweet caramel malt background, floral and citrus moderate hoppy aroma, biscuity and grassy dry finish, medium- bitterness. Light bodied, a bit too watery, soft carbonation.
Cm, Brewdog Leicester. Yellow gold with a white foam. Melon and white grape with mellow lemon. Yeasty with musty notes. Quite light bodied and slightly disappointing.

Can. Cheap beer shop, Sharrowvale, Sheffield. Hazy, orange gold. Open, bubbly, white head. Nose has fresh hop. Leafy and green. Light mineral. Taste is soft, fruity bitter. Light sweetness. Clean, light body. Short, bitter finish. Lovely, fresh hop aroma. Quaffable.

Nice sour ale here, coming in at 4.1 I expected it to be slightly sleds bitter. Hazy orange in appearance ,the aroma is very citrusy with peachy notes, taste is lemony with quite a bitter aftertaste. Would have again.
Can. Aroma is hoppy, bit of lemon, grass, b.o. hops. Taste is wheaty, floury, light hoppiness, bit dank. Not so exciting.
Cask. Hazy gold with medium white head. Fruity aroma, sweet malt flavour with smoothy fruity bitterness. Really drinkable
Il Birrificio bottle(7-Jan-16)Sweet citrus grapefruit aroma.Cloudy light amber,white head&ringed lace.Sweet grapefruit herbal flavour.Bitter grape herbal finish&steel herbal aftertaste.
Grapefruit sour hop Attila. Murky yellow colour great head and lacing. Sour malt herbal flavour. Smooth palate.

BB JUL2016. Poured a clouded orangey amber colour with 5mm of dense white foam for a head that retained Ok before diminishing to a collar that laced poorly. Carbonation medium to high and fine. Aroma strongly of hops, citrus (hints of grapefruit) and pine. Taste of sweet light malt with a moderate hops bitterness plus pine. Light body with a thin mouthfeel. Crisp and dry with a lingering moderate citrus bitterness.

Fruity floral aroma in a hazy light gold pour. Lovely tangy fruit taste with balanced both and crisp clean finish. An excellent beer - not just an excellent session beer (and slightly superior to its southern sibling).

Can thanks to Secret Santa! Pours hazy pale golden, medium creamy white head, dissipates slowly with nice lacing. Aroma is grassy, citrus, grapefruit, spruce. Flavor is very light sweet, light bitter, piney and grass, notes of citrus. Light body, lingering bitterness.

Tap (Wlodkowica21, Wroclaw). Piwo zmetnione o zlocisto-miodowej barwie, bialej lekko przybrudzonej pianie, srednio obfitej i tak samo trwalej ale ladnie oblepiajacej scianki szkla. Aromat intensywny, cytrusowy, grapefruitowy, swiezy. W smaku juz niestety duzo slabiej, gdzie oprocz srednio intensywnej, grapefruitowej goryczki niewiele sie dzieje, piwo jest plaskie, puste w odczuciu. I choc nie mozna mu odmowic pijalnosci to raczej szalu nie ma, choc aromat swietny.

Tasting glass draft @ 2de Bierproeffestival van De Dijleschuimers. Hazy orange, creamy white head. Nose is mellow yeasty peach, sweetish, very mellow canned fruit hop. Taste is mainly yeast, mildly sweet, hay, sugar, peach, fruity hops, mild lemon, Yeasty body. Others went wild for this one but a bit to basic, yeasty, okay for me.

Pours light golden, looks fresh and white foam head. Aroma is light citrus, barnyard hint of sourness. Taste is medium dry, thick body, long lasting dryness on tongue. Not mega fruity, but perhaps i should have waited for it to warm a little more.

Can shared at the return of Old Spice tasting. Pours cloudy blond with an off white head. Aroma of fruity hops, citrus, floral notes and light malt. Flavour is light sweet and moderate bitter. Light bodied with very soft carbonation.

33cl can courtesy of and shared with Kermis at the return of old spice tasting
Thick creamy white head. Cloudy blond pour. Hoppy aftertaste.
Bottle from Bob Cavanagh. Many thanks! Clear blond beer, white foam. Nose of pineapple, citrus. Dry and bitter aftertaste. Very well balanced. Again a very nice Moor beer!

330ml can @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours pale gold. Very light tropical citrus aroma. Taste is pleasant, easy-going and very pint-worthy. Not too much going on but its harmless enough and effectively does what it says on the tin. Sessionable blonde with a floral citrus hop nod.

23/X/15 - 33cl can from a trade @ home - BB: VII/2016 (2015-1501) Thanks to ElManana+1 for the trade!
Clear blond beer, creamy irregular off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of exotic fruits, passion fruit, mango, citrus, bit floral, pineapple. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of citrus, exotic fruits, bit grassy, grapefruit, bit resinous, lovely stuff! Aftertaste: citrus, pineapple, fruity, some peach, nice refreshing bitterness, resinous, piny, very lovely beer!
Hand Pump, @Ale&Hop, Barcelona. 14/11/2015.Color amarillo turbio, sabor frutal, dulce.

330ml can . Im pissed that this is listed as a Low boost Gold on the database, looks bad on my stats, expected an APA at least . Citric nose . Gold with an ok white foam. Flavours pine resin rich hops , juicy and cloyingly sappy but a light floral citrus dryness amalgamated to the texture is nice . More an APA than a gold and I drank this cold which is bad I know .
Cask. Pours hazy and pale golden with a medium white head subsiding slowly. Scent is lemon, light. Taste is dense lemon zest and light hops. Good.
Pale yellow with light haze and lasting head. Aroma and flavour have piney, resinous hops but also some citrusy grapefruit too. Very light and easy to drink.
Can from Bottlecraft, Hanley. Pours pale golden with white froth. Very well hopped, smooth honey, touch of flora. More hop. Cracking beer

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2016 From the can. Pours a hazy golden colour with a white head. Heady aroma of pine and grapefruit. Taste is very fresh and fruity with notes mandarin, pine, grapefruit and mango. Very appealing and elegant. For a low-strength beer this packs an incredible punch taste-wise.

Re-tried 7/10/2016. Still superb, with delicate notes of peach and mandarin. No need to change the rating!

0,33 boks fra Prohibition Wine, Muswell Hill, delt med Steven: this is the business - pregnant aroma og smak av tropiske frukter, mandarin og granskudd i en kledelig maltkropp. Slank og elegant som en ballettdanser. Myk og avrundet i kantene, pikant ettersmak. Jeg etter fyller glasset.

can, at home. Pours pale yellow, small steady white head. Agreeable light grassy and citrussy nose, nice grapefruit aroms. Light body, a tad watery but that makes it extremely drinkable. Taste is pine hops, a bit of cheese. Nice.

Draft sample at the Great British Weekend New Edition 2015 Belgrade Serbia.13.09.2015.Pour it hazy yellow color with small white head.Aroma of grapefruit.Taste exotic fruits, some honey, good note all together.Really light and easy drinkable.

aroma afrutado con un color dorado turbio y espuma de consistencia media. muy ligera de alcohol y se nota al tomarla. se podria beber esta cerveza durante mucho rato sin notas los efectos. la he conseguio en formato 0.66.

On tap at Bibere Bistrot pub in Rome-Italy. Pours cloudy yellow, milky white foam with retention. Nose: citric (fresh), hay, yeast. Mouth: frizzy carbonation, peppery chili finish, zest, lemonade, easy going beer. Great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can from Beerhive. Light hazy gold, small white head. Citrus and floral nose. Medium body, soft fizz. More citrus and floral hops. Light bitter finish. Pretty good.

Bevuta alla spina. Giallo scuro, con schiuma bianca. Aromi di limone e tropicale e di ananas. Meraviglioso finale...
Che meraviglia di birra. OTTIMO

Draught @ YNWA, Kolding. Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grass, light sweet, fruity hops, peach. Flavor is light sweet, malt, grass, fruity, grapes. Thin to medium body, lively carbonation, light bitter finish. Nice and very easy to drink. 110915

330ml can BB July 2016, 4.1%. Dark yellow, opaque, sparkling, decent big cratered white head. Aroma is lemon tart, some metallics with some egg custard. Body is light, spritzy carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is straw, pineapple, dry and citrussy. Very drinkable, great balance, such a clean flavour. Nice hop action up front, but this falls away unless you take breaks from drinking it. Definitely one to drink very fresh.
Origin: Can. Vessel: Can. Supplier: Arcadia (Bristol). Subtle hoppy nose. Smooth and light.
Dorado turbio y espuma blanca compacta. Aromas cítricos, pomelo, pino y menta. Cuerpo bajo con sabor intenso como en el aroma y final de amargor seco medio.

Pint on tap @ Homo Sibaris. Pours golden with medium white frothy head. Aromas of citrus, tangerine and tropical fruits. The flavour is more orange-like, the tropical touch is there but not significant. Some bitterness, far from an IPA, very easy to drink and refreshing. Light/medium body, perfect carbonation. Really nice session beer, impossible to dislike this one.
Draft at Billie. Golden pour. Aroma of citrus and grain. Taste is bitter and dry, with fresh citrus and some pale malt grain. Very good for a golden ale.

Aroma: citrus fruits, light floral notes, grain malts. Appearance: light, pale, hazy gold, small, creamy, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: bitters intensify, floral hops, some acidity, dry finish, lively carbonation. Overall: very nice Golden Ale, really more an APA. Pint at Draft House Charlotte Street, Fitzrovia.
tried at the Bath Brew House, Bath. Slightly hay golden colour with a white head. The aroma is slightly hoppy, but certainly not big hops. taste is refreshing.
22 oz. bottle. It pours a lightly hazy colour, with a nice aroma :citrus and florals. Medium body and carbonation. Ok
From tap. Pale golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus hops. Beer is dry, fruity with a decent amount of bitterness.

[5935-20131019] Cask. Lemon orange peel aroma. Hazy, pale orange brown body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Bitter orange peel flavour has a long-lasting bitter citrus lychee aftertaste. Medium body is a little bitter. Interesting. (7/3/7/3/14) 3.4
(Cask Days 2013 @ Brickworks, Toronto, ON)

On tap.
Pale hazy Golden, small White head.
Very subtle Nose, hint of hops. Crisp taste, notes of fruity hops. 
Light body, average carbonation.

Meravigliosa golden ale inglese fatta alla perfezione dalla mano di questo grande birrificio. Colore oro con schiuma bianca. Al naso note floreali, agrumi e miele. In bocca corpo medio leggero e bilanciata benissimo con sapore di luppolo fresco e malto. Finale pulito e aromaticamente persistente. Questa birra è un vero spasso per il palato, ultra beverina e pericolosa visto che non stanca mai!

In bottiglia. Colore oro carico, piuttosto limpida, schiuma fine, non molto abbondante, mediamente persistente. Aroma intenso erbaceo, fiori di campo, citrico. Al palato corpo snello, sentori di erba appena tagliata, fiori di campo, lime e finale secco ed amaro ma non eccessivo. Ottima birra!

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2014 Tap @ Angleterre, Helsinki 30/08/14, thanks Gastjale. Pours a hale yellow with a good, white head. Aroma is hoppy, citrusy, some tropical guava. Taste is much of the same, grapefruit is stronger. Light with good carbonation.
Cask at Urban Tap House, Cardiff, late August 2014. Not as hoppy as the brewery blurb suggests, but a great session ale nonetheless.
Bottle from The Wine Rmpirium June 2013. Middle of the range golden ale with so e nice fruitiness in both aroma and flavour. An easy drinking beer.

Hazy golden color. Frothy white, big fresh hoppy nose with flowers, honey and a touch of pine. That nose is amazing. Light body, very hop accented, but very gentle hops makes everything work. Nice light bitter finish. Superbly refreshing. World class Golden Ale.

Keg at The Hanging Bat. Pours clear pale gold, thin white head. Aromas of citrus, pine, tropical fruit. Taste brings it together with a light malt backbone. Creamy texture, clean finish. Amazing for the low abv (esp. compared to the kernel tasted alongside).
Bottle at home, as Northern Star. Pours golden yellow, nose is light lemon, taste is bitter, sweet citrus.
Draft. A golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of hops, malt, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, flowers, and straw, leading to a bitter finish.
Cask at Old Fountain, 28th July 14. Solid Golden, good drinkable flavour, pretty tasty all round.

Draught @ Harrys, Jyväskylä. Aroma has fruity hops and apricot. Also some mandarin. Flavour has fruity hops, strong mineral tones, apricot and honts of citrus. Too dry, Id like this to have more fruits.
UPDATED: FEB 4, 2015 Superb hoppy fruity flavour with a really good aroma. A top pint for those that like American style hops

Bevuta diverse volte sia in bottiglia che alla spina. Pale ale molto beverina, corpo leggero, un buon naso, agrumato e fresco, non invadente. Buon amaro di supporto, retro-olfatto che richiama tropici e frutta fresca. 
Decisamente godibile, soprattutto a pompa.

(Keg at Pikkulintu, 20140702) The beer poured golden and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, grain and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, sweetness, pine, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy, sweet and bitter. A good hoppy pale ale.

Draught at Pint Shop, Cambridge on 28 June. Poured a hazy yellow, with a thin white head. Aroma of apricots, citrus and dough. Sweet flavours of tinned fruit, pineapples, balanced with some dry straw. Finish was dry with some grain and lingering grassy hop.

Tap at Gallows Bird, Espoo. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, some sweetness, hints of citrus, some grain, floral, hops and malts. Amazing body for this ABV.
bevuta sia in bottiglia che in fusto di lotti differenti, di facile beva appagante, da bere a litri

22 oz. bottle dated best by 3/20/15. It pours a lightly hazy yellow color with a small white head. The aroma is very nice with strong, tangy citrus and some florals. Lemon/lime with some light bready malt. The flavor is the same. Lemon, lime, florals with some background crackers and honey. Mildly bitter finish. The body is light, but packed with flavor. Nice stuff.

Cask at Sandford Park Ale House. Pours lightly hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is earthy, dank, herbal, and sweaty socks with light cracker malt. Flavor is moderate hops and medium bitterness with light malt and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Cask west riding dewsbury. Hazy golden colour ok white head lacing. Aroma is citrus mango. Taste is good sweet malts mango citrus grapefruit hops nice bitter finish. Great full body and mouthfeel for a golden. Great stuff
On tap at Birratrovo in Como. Pale with a rich white froth, hoppy and fruity aroma. Light malty sweetness with a dry bitter finish, lovely aromatic hops. A great one for hot sunny days.
Cask in the Bridge Inn, Newcastle. Slightly hazy golden with a white head. Really nice fresh hoppy flavour. Some apple notes with bitter citrus and pine. refreshing and easy drinking. Very good.

Clean golden color, medium white head. Sweet aroma of malt, caramel, tropical fruits, some floral notes. Taste has malt, citrus, yeast, grass - dry with light sweetness and medium bitter hoppy finish. Light to medium body and lively carbonation. Nice ale with fruity notes, very drinkable.

660ml bottle from Beer Central Sheffield. Pours a straw colour with a bright white head, smell is of passion fruit and sweet lemon. Initial sweet taste of oranges and grass leading to a long citrus infused bitter finish. A very nice beer indeed, only one draw back is the 660ml bottle when pouring into a pint glass, what remains in the bottle disturbs the sediment.

Bottled. 15cl sample.The aroma has citrus, tropical fruits, some grass. Clear, yellow coloured beer with a whin, white head. The taste is moderate bitter, citric, has some biscuity malts. Dry mothfeel, thin body. Full of taste. Good.

0,66L bottle. Pours hazy golden with white head. Aroma is hoppy citrus and mango. Taste: slight sweetness, citrus, pine, grapefruit, mango, peach. Long grapefruit bitter finish with some tart and hints of sweetness. Overall: nice light, but hoppy beer.

Bottle shared by martjoobolut. Hazy yellow, white head. Nose is hoppy, slight malt and peachy-floral-herbal notes. Taste has grapefruit, mango, lychee, mild biscuity malt, hints of straw. Dry finish with sweet hints. Medium body, soft carbonation, watery texture. Very drinkable, probably very sessionable.

Bottle at the gun. £9 clear golden colour with a light frothy white head. Aroma is chive lemon hop. Flavour is clean biscuity malt. flavour has some elderflower floral notes . Grassy and lemon zest hop. Finish is dry crisp finish. Hint of spicy hop. Tasty beer. Some solid tropical fruit as well. Poundable. Surely this is an APA? Admins?

Cask at The Gun. It pours a golden body with a small white head. Aroma is bitter and hoppy with notes of lychee, mango, grass. Taste is grainy and grassy with citrus and fruity hops. Mouthfeel is medium with soft carbonation. Good.

660ml bottle [4.3% abv]. Clear golden colour with small to average, frothy to creamy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Citrusy hoppy aroma with minimally floral, grassy and herbal undertones, a touch of elderflower. Taste is minimally sweet biscuity pale malty, citrusy and minimally floral hoppy overtones, hints of lemon and lemon zest, a cautious strawy touch, some elderflower; soft palate. Superbly balanced, rightly upper limit of its style.

Where and how:  Cask Days 2013 
Aroma bolder. Approachable dryness, nice leafy fruity bitterness. Sweet berry like finish.
 Appearance : 
Top: medium rocky white top. 
Base: hazy dark gold ale
Palate :  medium bodied, softer, easy going with delicate carbonation. Average finish.
Taste: easy going, sessionable bitter ale. Nice supporting body.
 Other notes  refreshing

650mL bottle (BB 31.5.14). Pours a very pale straw colour with a sweet citrus bouquet with a berry like hint and unfortunately some skunk. The skunk is overpowering in the follow, hard to pull anything. im sure this would be a great beer fresh alas the bottle in front of me is far from it.

(Bottle): Hazy pale gold with a small white head. Aroma of grass, hops, citrus, malt, straw, floral. A quite zesty citrus taste with malt, grass, floral notes punching through also faint pine and tropical fruit notes. Nice bitterness but not too much. Arguably the best in this style.

[10/2/13] Cask at Euston Tap in London. Hazy golden with a white head. Great hoppy aroma full of tropical fruits, weed and a bit of citric notes. Dry flavor of fruity hops and a citric and grassy bitter finish. Medium-bodied. Very nice.

2013-10-19. Hazy bright pastel orange body small frothy head. 3+ Aroma is pleasantly hoppy interesting grassy citrusy character, mild lemon. 7+ Flavour is similar, mild, lemony grassy hops. Smooth average bodied palate, soft carbonation. Nice stuff. Session 1, Cask Days 2013, Toronto

0.66 l bottle, thanks hanniku! Hazy golden color. Perfumed and citrusy aroma with earthy pepper hops. Dry bitter, salty and citrusy taste with earthy peppery hops and hint of plastic. Light bodied, some hop astringency. Strong lingering bitterness. Aroma is good, taste is slighty too astringent and roughly bitter.

Very nice for golden ale. Pours cloudy blonde with nice visuals. Nice residual hops with great barley profile. Comes on with light citrus-flavoured hops on nose and finishes with light sweetness. Cask Days 2013.

66 cl bottle.
Pours pale clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma is fruity and hoppy, some floral notes, pale malts and grass also. Flavor is also fruity with hay, some malty notes, goose berries and hops. Nice balance, a bit thin-bodied but doesnt really matter, tasty.
3414
Pint at the White Horse in Chelmsford. Opaque yellow-orange with a light, white head. Smooth, light citrus hop taste, not overly bitter. Pleasant citrus aroma.

A hazy, slightly orange beer with an almost medium and white head. The nose is slightly tropical, mangos, peaches, also more sophisticated nuancees, some pine needles and citrusfruits. Taste is almost dry and fresh, tropical fruity, biscuity malts, surprisingly intensive bitterness, strong but smoothly biting. Almost medium bodied, fresh and medium carbonation. The srongly bittery, easy and fresh Golden Ale, this is good beer.
Frischer, trocken hopfiger Antrunk. Bitterer werdend, ab dem Mittelteil deutlich herb. Süffig, zum Ende recht trocken. 9/9/10/9/7/9
Cask at the Hare and Billet, Blackheath. Gold pour with a white head. Grapefruit, vanilla and wet moss aroma. Orange zest and grapefruit flavour. Quite bitter. Bitter finish. Not bad.

A nice light unfiltered citrusy pale ale. Surprisingly clear for a unfiltered pale ale. Nice aromas and palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap(@Craft Beer Co., Clerkenwell):Golden.hazy, small persistent white foamy layer, citrussy and grainy nose with a grassy touch; moderate dry bitter flavour, light bodied but not watery; slightly lingering bitter-fruity finish. O.K., but I expected more

660ml bottle from Ales by Mail
BBE 31 Jul 2014 - Pours clear golden with a bubbly white head. Aroma of fresh grassy and floral hops, citrus, crisp maltiness and hints of lemon. Taste is hoppy, fruity and floral with notes of citrus, malts and grass. Finish is dry, fruity and bitter with floral hops and citrus. Quite nicely balanced and tasty session ale. Great stuff.

Half pint, keg at Holyrood 9A.Next to clear golden coloured body. Missing head. Fresh grass and sweet fruity nose. Lemony hops joined by berries in the taste profile and supported by juicy malts. Fruity, mid-bitter end. Medium to thin bodied. Well balanced, refreshing and with fine drinkability, (Edinburgh 10.08.2013).

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2013 660 ml bottle.
Pours a cloudy bright yellow colour with a thick white head. Aroma of juicy orange fruitiness, hops, green apples, some honey and flowers. Flavour of strong and crisp floral and citrusy bitterness, pale malts, orange, pungent grapefruit, pine, hay and very delicate sweetness. Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel and a very crisp, lingering, dry, floral, grapefruity finish. After five minutes the bitterness is still lingering on. The bitterness here is better than on many APA?s or even IPA?s. Excellent golden ale with very prominent bitterness and excellent drinkability. I could drink this every day. Hopheads - have this.
Cask @ Ale & Hop, Barcelona
Compared to the bottle version this one feels much stronger hop-wise, and I heard this cask is a fresh one. Much stronger bitterness with mellow caramel notes and herbs. Drinkability is so good I had to take a couple of pints more just to make sure Im right. The best golden ale Ive had so far.

August 28, 2013 - cask at The Pelt Trader. Lightly hazy gold with a smallish lasting off-white head. Aroma and taste are light hay, oily grain, vague pear, tons of grassy and citrus zest bitterness. Lovely. Light-ish body, astringent, perfect cask carbonation and a medium-long dry non-aggressive session beer finish. Superb drinker.
Damn fine. Great APA. Hop head bliss. Low on malt, just the way I like it. Fantastic taste considering the lower abv - which is no bad thing.
cask at Auld Hoose. hazy gold, hoppy, fruity crisp go profile, goes down smooth. a fine pint.

Pours a clear off yellow, small bubbles and keeps a thin head. Smell is pine and citrus, Forrest floor, mild. Taste is more of the same, but might be getting beyond the point of being able to tell! Nice, in an unobtrusive way.
Cloudy light gold, no head; aroma of tropical fruit; tastes of the same - gooseberries and strong grassy hops; lightly sweet; moreish and just a really excellent beer.

Bottle, 12C. 4.3%ABV. Slightly hazy gold, appears still beneath the white head. Aroma of lemon and orange blossoms, honey, grass. Light bodied, alive-feeling, lowish carbonation. Lots of juicy and zesty citrus flavours - oranges, lemons, some grapefruit and mandarin, also some mango. A little honey rides over stern pale malt. Firm bitterness. Classy and refreshing.

Bottle from Matkroken Natland, Bergen. Pours a clear light golden body with a small off-white head. Nose is perfumy peach tones, apricot, rose water, wet grass, citric peel and hints of Elderflower and pale malts. Taste is peaches, rose water, citrus, grass and hints of apricot, pale malts, straw and flowers. Light body (bordering on watery, which is the only drawback here) and soft to medium carbonation. Very refreshing stuff with a lot of complexity from the American hops in addition to the accessibility of the traditional Brit-style golden ale. I like it a lot.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2015 Color: hazy blond beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: hops, fruity, peach, litchi. Taste: fresh taste of hops and really fruity as peach and litchi. Aftertaste: nice bitterness with a small sugar expression.

Cask at Wenlock Arms. It pours hazy golden yellow with a small white head. The nose is earth, floral, herbal, creaminess, spice, grass and aprcot. The taste is crisp, earth, floral, light grass, grapefruit, pithy orange, apricot, straw and good level of bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Smooth, tasty and damn refreshing. Good work! A great session beer.

On bottle from Ølhamdleriet, Mathallen-Oslo. Golden color, good foam. Good hoppy aromas, also good fruity and floral tones. Medium/ light body & medium complexity. Good bitterness, well balanced. Very enjoyable

66cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. Some citrus, fruity aromas. Pours golden, hazy, with vanishing white head, some lacing. Light to medium body, average carbonation, some crispy texture. Taste is quite hoppy, some bitter, citrusy. Light and refreshing, enjoyable.
Brilliant. Most likely will be the best golden I ever have. So good I had two glasses. Yum.
Short Review. Had on tap at the Local taphouse in Darlinghurst. Nice light session ale. Not huge amount of flavour but still plenty for a session beer.
On tap at Mediona. Clear golden colour with white head. Hoppy and caramel aroma. Hoppy resinous and caramel taste.

my brother bought a bottle of this at Port Street Bar, so i made sure to get some for a rate, he was tired of cask beers .. . bright and refreshing .. . citrus and very light pine .. . slick and easy, a nice beer .. . . I have serious reservations about the word "ointment."
Cask at euston tap. Pours a golden straw colour. Nice retained head. Smells of citrus . Excellent beer.
Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma is malt, citrus, peach and tropical fruit. Flavour follows the nose.
Keg, Pratts and Payne, London. Cloudy straw colour, small creamy head with good lacing. Huge citrus hops on nose. Big hop flavour with well balanced bitterness. Could be fuller - slight watery feel.

0.66l bottle. This looks pretty much the same as the sohop really; bright golden, blurry in the glass with a medium to small just off-white top. The nose is a bit lower though. Its fruity, I get tones of peaches, caramel and fresh hops. Definitely nice enough. It has a soft small prickling carbonation level and a somewhat thin almost watery lightdrinkable mouthfeel. The flavors are also really likable in this. Fresh grassy hops with a subdued fruitiness lurking in the background. Some soft caramel gives it a nice sweetness and it feels really balanced. If I had better access to this it could easily become my lawnmower beer. Of course I would first get a lawnmower and a lawn. 28.03.2013

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2013 A pleasing mid colour gold with a vibrantly active head. Not very aromatic, lightly astringent, not a great palate, the kind of ale a larger drinker could go for. Quite bitter but quite refreshing also, not amazing.

(Cask at Holborn Whippet, Holborn, London, 23 Apr 2013) Golden colour, slightly hazy, with frothy white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with notes of citrus, grapefruit and grass. Fruity, hoppy taste with citrus, grapefruit, resin, gooseberries and generous amounts of fresh hops in the finish. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Nice and refreshing.
Chiara discreta schiuma media persistenza agrumata citrica fruttats frutta esotica lichees mango pesca lieve non molto corpo poco gassata amaro medio buona secchezza
Cask at Southern. Pronounced floral aroma with light citrus flavour. I was surprised at the big scores for this beer - I thiught is was decidedly average.

Cask at the Euston Tap, 03/04/13.
Lightly hazed pale yellow with a thin white head, heavy lacing ensues.
Nose carries fresh hops, grapefruit, orange pith, citrus, pale malts, touch of floral to this one also.
Taste comprises orange, grapefruits, hops, light pine needles.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, light bitterness in the finish,
Decent sessionable hoppy cask fayre!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Decent hoppy beer, could use a small boost, but overall its decent to good, specially cause I was suspecting some bad beer for sure. A small surprise.

14th April 2012As Northern Star. Very hazy gold beer, good white head. Smooth palate with fine carbonation. Creamy pale malt. Nice mild citric orange hops. A little grapefruit. Minerals. Semi dry finish with more mild citrus. Super drinkable.

Draught at Ölrepubliken, Göteborg, Sweden. Shady golden, large white head. Tropical fruit hop aroma with grapefruit and lime. Light bodied, medium to high carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness. Very refreshing.

Draught. Creamy whit lasting head. Clear golden body. Fruity grassy aroma and flavor with lovely notes of honey,  high carbonation and a long bittersweet finish. Quite tasty and very well balanced. Impressive for a beer with such low alcohol contents.

66cl bottle (nice & fresh). Pours light gold with thin white head - plenty of lacing. Aroma is delicious: lots of wonderful mango, lime, tangerine, floral notes, pine needles and spruce. Taste follows suit with an incredible hit of citrus, pine resin and loads of delectable tropical fruit (pineapple and mango especially). Such wonderful pale malt character - just a touch of biscuit sweetness in there to frame the amazing hop hit. Residual pine & citrus character & a lingering bitterness on the palate. Medium/thin mouthfeel, perfect carb. Finish is crisp and dry. My good lord, this is incredible. I could drink this all day long for ever more. Tomorrow im going out to buy as many of these as I can carry. Moor, once again, you have excelled yourselves.

Draft @ Söder Om Småland, Malmö. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy citrus aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter finish.

Draught at The Rover. Somewhat hazy pale golden beer with a rich lasting white head. Hoppy citrus aroma, lemongrass, pine notes, grapefruit, caramel, floral notes, orange, metal notes, perfume, lime, some herbal notes. Hoppy floral flavor, lemongrass, citrus, lots of grapefruit, pine needles, lemongrass, herbal notes, metal, orange, citrus, lime, some mango. Almost aggressive hoppiness, but very fresh and full of flavor. Citrus finish with lemongrass, grapefruit and some floral notes.

Sprucey, honey nose with hints of elderflower.  Pours a hazy gold with a slight, fluffy head and strong lace.  Flavour is gooseberry and lychee with a long bitter piney finish.  Very thirst-quenching and very moreish.

Aroma is straight elderflower, with some other fruit and grass if you dwell into it for too long. Head is good and light, like the beer itself (it actually looks too pale to be interesting! Surprise!). There is a good bitterness in the flavour, accompanied by tropical fruit and a very citrusy overtone. No overt maltiness, but some very slight sweetness balances the beer out. In general, a very light, refreshing, hoppy beer. In a way not unusual, but does deliver what it promises.

Cask at Rake with Sarah. Pours a hazy pale gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has notes of pine and citrus with a hint of dankness. Flavor starts with light citrus that mellows to bitter grass and a bit of light grains in the finish.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines labelled as Northern Star; pours straw yellow frothy white head citrus zesty hop nice carbonation good beer.
Cloudy golden with a big white head. Citrus and peach hoppy aroma, with a grainy malty note. Dry and malty flavour with citrus hops and a rather raw and harsh bitterness

Tap at the Holborn Whippet. Light yellow colour, thin white head. Aroma nice, lemon, straw and hops. Dry flavour, very pleasant on palate, good bitter hop finish. Excellent example of this dry, hoppy English pale summery bitter style.

660ml bottle from Tuckers Maltings. Hazy pale yellow, large, creamy white head, superb hop aroma hovering all over the place. Solid, intensive malty base with loads of resiny, grassy hops that also have a touch of citrus fruit. Perfectly balanced, delicious.

Aroma: Lemon, hay, grapefruit.

Appearance: Hazy, pale golden body with a light, bubbly white head that slowly fades. Very light carbonation. 

Taste: Light, refreshing and citrusy. If I had to guess, Id say Citra hops have been generously used here. Lovely bitter finish. 

Palate: Thin to medium body with a Gentle carbonation. 

Overall: This is the first Moor beer Ive tasted - on this evidence, it wont be the last. This is truly delicious, a great session golden ale. It reminds me of Fyne Ales Jarl (which I prefer... just).

On tap. Hazy yellowish with a creamy and lacing white head. Intense, exotic, tropical fruit aroma. Light body, soft mouthfeel, dry fruit accents and again lovely tropical aroma hops - maybe a little dusty - with a dry lightly bitter finish. 270712

[keg at the Holyrood 9A, Edinburgh] Big grapefruit flavours from the off here. Hazy golden amber with a small white head. Lots of sharp citrus on the nose. The flavour too  very grapefruity. Dry finish  really very nice indeed, particularly given the session-strength abv [14072012]

Keg at holyrood9a.
Pale blonde. Mango on the nose, sweet up front then dry bitterness.

660ml bottle (as Northern Star). Pours a lovely gold colour with a big head. Some sediment towards the end. Aroma is beautifully hoppy: lusciously fruity and lightly floral. The aroma could stand up to some of the best IPAs. Packs in plenty of nice bitterness on the tongue. Lots of flavour and body for the low ABV, which is an achievement in itself. At times I wished it was a few percentage points higher, but there are other beers out there that could satisfy that craving. For something near the 4% mark this is highly impressive.

Bottle, Stirchley Wines, Birmingham. As Northern Star. Light clear gold pour with a nice plump off white head. Aroma was an intriguing mish mash of farmyard, yeast, tropical fruit and grassy hop. Fairly lively carbonation.  Plenty of citrus and earthy hop character in the flavour. Good balance Steadily building bitter linger. Quality beer.

Bottle.Tried as northern star.  Bronze ad cloudy which put me off at first. Medium head ad lots of citrus that really hits hard. Some hops as well make for a powerful ad pleasant beer. Pity about the poor appearance.
Bottle. Golden. Enticing nose of orangey hops. A lot of citrus hop flavour. A little thin bodied but incredibly flavoursome for the ABV.

very Moorish! and two beers for the price of one! 
the first a clear (no yeast) very pale golden straw and a foamy head.
lovely aromas of citrus peel and some tropical fruits. lemony flavour. bitter sweet finish.
the second a cloudy yellow! similar flavours but the mouth feel is much more satisfying.

bottle. wineways. harrogate
660ml bottle.  Pours pale, floral, grapefruit and slight honey nose.  Plenty of citrus taste, grapefruit, zesty.  Tangy palate.  Enjoyable. Refreshing,
Massive flavour for the low abv. Cloudy, loads of citrus grapefruit.. hoppy sweet bitter. Good one.

Bottle, bought @ YNWA, Kolding. Pours hazy yellow with a firm, staying, frothy, white head. Aroma has grapefruit, grass, citrus, sweet malts. Medium carbonation, fine dry mouthfeel. Flavour has lovely hoppy dryness, pine, grass, grapefruit, mild citrus. Lingering bitterness. Very lovely.

Bottle from Alesela
Pale straw, hazy, big frothy white head
Aroma of citrus fruits, pineapple, some grapefruit, bit of hay, pale malts, fairly strong hoppy aroma
Taste - lots of citrus hops, grapefruit, tropical fruits, pineapple, bitter zest, bit of yeast, sweet pale malts, fairly acidic, less fruity more bitter zest than aroma, wet hay
Palate - medium to high carb, too fizzy, light body, citrus bitter zest palate. Finish as main flavour, citrus bitter, bit astringent (in a good way), cleans well
Overall - Well made Golden ale but too fizzy so only managed  to fill 2/3 pint then lots of yeast afterwards unfortunately

Bottle @ YNWA, Kolding. Unclear yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and ratehr hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 240312

Golden straw colored pour. Huge, tight, creamy white head that slowly recedes, leaving a swath of lacing in its wake. Huge danky hop aroma. A peppery spicy floral aroma as well. Peppery taste, with some flowers mixed in. Sweet, crisp, slightly bitter. Nice.

From bottle. Over primed, slowly gushed out the bottle after opening. Pours very cloudy golden with decent white head. Delicious aroma, piney, passion fruit, mango. Taste is very nice and fruity at first but then spoiled by a yeasty after taste. Easy going on the palate, dry finish. Decent. Earlier Rating: 2/19/2012 Total Score: 3.8Cask at Caley. Nice big fruity hop aroma, mango, passion fruit and oranges. Taste doesnt quite live up to the smell but still quite fuity and hoppy, caramel malty backbone comes through. Some co2. Very nice but reckon Id prefer from a bottle

cask at caley sample rooms .... golden amber yellow ... thin white head ... soft zezty citrus nose ... sweet orange zezty ... light peppery hop .... juicy ... light bittee peel lingerEarlier Rating: 6/13/2011 Total Score: 3.7cask at cloisters .. golden yellow ... zezty sweet very nice lemon hop nose ...bitter lemon front ... juicy sweet lemon linger ... nice

660ml from Alexander Wines, Coventry. Enough to share...but too good to give away. Pours bright gold to weizen hazy (depending on the DTs) with a fine, clinging foam. Beautiful hop aroma of lychee, passion fruit, slight cheesiness with a good sweat of greenery behind it. Lean and crisp with crackery, peanut malts beneath a bittersweet, citrusy stew of hop. Notes of ganja, Rubicon, general lemon and lime soapiness, flowers. Thick and translucent with the gunk in like Kernel. Top stuff.

04/02/2011 Brasserie 4:20 (cask). Dorata viva con riflessi ambrati, schiuma praticamente assente. Aroma deciso, elegantemente amaro, con note fruttate di pesca e pompelmo ed erbacee, lievemente caramellate. In bocca ha un sapore più amaro, secco e deciso della Southern Star, grazie alla luppolatura americana, che però non risulta mai invadente. Secca, con spiccate note citriche. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Freschissima, pulita, elegante e beverina.
Top notch stuff from Moor as always - really resiny hop flavour without becoming annoying which is not the easiest thing to do. Judas Priest!

Cask. Golden color with a modest off-white head. Very sweet nose - sugars, maple syrup, white grapes. The taste is sweet, with grassy hops providing a balanced bitterness. The body is  light and  balanced. Theres plenty of character to this beer. Very good. Win.

Szép világossárga színű sör hab nélkül, ahogy az egy frissen csapravert jó állapotú real ale-től elvárható. Nagyon érdekes és erős aromája van. Először gumicukornak tűnik, aztán licsire asszociálunk, végül beugrik: mangó. Tökéletes és összetéveszthetetlen mangóíze van. A teste könnyű, vizes, egy kicsit mégis olajos. Némi kis tengervizes sósság is vegyül bele, ha jól emlékszem, bár ezt a jegyzeteim nem támasztják alá. Az utóíze a könnyed komlóé.

Cask (handpump) @ GBBF 2011, Great British Beer Festival, Earls Court Exhibition Centre, London, England.Clear medium yellow orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, pale malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, grass, grapefruit. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, lemon citrus, fresh. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20110803]

Cask at The Pontefract Castle, London. Pours a clear, pale gold with a medium, white head. Glorious nose of fresh grass, grapefruit, straw and crackers. Flavor follows through well with a really meaty bitterness of ripe citrus and grass, along with sun-kissed malts and grain. Light to medium bodied with fine, delicate carbonation. Clean, dry and fresh finish, some lovely citrus, almost tangy, and lingering grass. Mild sugar balances it out. This is really superb stuff.
Cask @ Curlers Rest. Golden colour, off-white head. Nose is massive fruits, citrus and grapefruit. Flavour is fresh citric, grapefruit. Zesty, bitter and juicy. Fruity finish. Excellent.
Cask @ GBBF, 2011. Pours cloudy yellow with  a creamy white head and lacings. Floral, citrus and hay. Citrussy and lemon flavor - very crisp and hoppy. Smooth. Lovely.
Cask at GBBF 2011, Wednesday. Clear golden - white head. Grassy, citrus, ok hoppy, sharpness, nice light bitterness, light malty, golden malty, light flowery.

Cask at GBBF 2011. 
Clear amber coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of citrus, grass and hops.
Fruity flavour of citrus, grass and hops.
Dry hoppy finish.

Cask at GBBF 2011. Pours a golden orange colour with a thin white head.  Plenty of fruit and citrus hops in the aroma, the taste again is all malty and fruit with more than a hint of grapeffruit, with a dry bitter finish.

Hand pulled at the Old Contemptibles, Birmingham. Bright yellow, with white fluff. Smells deliciously inviting. Flavour is light and airy, but packed with deep, rich lemony hop zing. Some dusty sourness peaks round the curtains mid-way, but the full fresh hops reemerge through the satisfying finish. Really, really good.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2013 Cask conditioned	handpump	Southwark Tavern	London.  A yellow blonde coloured beer with a white head.  A delicious hoppy aroma, with lashings of citrus particularly tangerines.  A really good clean hoppy mouth too.  Very good hopping with malty balance.  Really lovely.  Score 3.9Subsequent ratings scored 3.8 and 3.6. Average becomes 3.8

UPDATED: APR 22, 2016 Cask at the Southwark Tavern, Borough. Hazy pale amber in colour with a thin white head; citrus aroma; lemony citrus flavour with some fresh grassy hops providing a gently bitter, resinous, finish. Good character. (7/12/2011 - 6/3/6/4/13=3.2)33cl can from Beer52.com. A pale straw pour with a loose white head; light lemony citrus aroma; crisp lemony taste with some grassy hops; and a gentle grassy finish with some sweetness. (4/22/2016 - 6/4/6/3/13=3.2)

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2015 Cask @ The Drum & Monkey & 330ml can from Valhallas Goat. Golden yellow colour, not much head. Hop, citrus fruit & resin aroma. Hop & citrus fruit flavour. Bitter aftertaste. A hybrid between a golden ale and a more hoppy pale ale.

On cask at Cloisters. Pours a golden colour with a thick white head. Amazing sweet bubblegum aroma. Bubblegum flavour which lingers with some dryness and fruits. Tastes a little thin but still very nice.
Cask at Cloisters. Yellow amber. Good creamy white head. Lemony citrus nose, good hop front with nutty malt to back it up. Decent citrus linger.

Cask, handpump at a Nicholsons pub, London, 04.06.11   Pours warm gold with a filmy white head. Really good crispness from the off. Touch of light vanilla and oakiness in the mouth, some bitterness surges through. V. Nice.   A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.6
Cask handpull at Wellington Nicholson London.  Grassy really drinkable.  Lovely finish on the finish.  Good mouthfeel grassy hops
tap@ brasserie 4:20. Good beer for a starter, mild hoppy fruits a good head. Pleasant mild taste of flower smells. The foam stays long in the glas. Mild and gentle brew.
Cask at Cask Pub and Kitchen, Pimlico, London. A golden coloured pour with a smallish white head. Fruity, hoppy aroma. Tastes quite fruity, hoppy, pineapple. Rather thin and plain.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2011 Draught @ Brasserie 4:20 (Rome) - Another incredible golden ale by Moor, sincerely I prefer the Southern Star Cask I had some weeks ago, but this one is great too! Fresh, elegant, quite perfect. The aroma is intense, light but perfectly balanced, honey, apple, grapefruit and hops. I think I could drink 10 pint and I would have mo(o)re!

Draught (Brew wharf, London)
6 Dusty and grapefruity hops.
3 Gold, small head
6 SImple golden ale taste, light grains back up the hops.
4 Pleasant palate, carbonation low. Bitter. Resiny finish.
13 Simple, but well rounded bitter.

Cask conditioned at Minehead Beer Festival 10. Pale gold with white head. Good crisp malt, biscuity, carrying a tender, fruity, lemony hop. It dries into bitterness, with quite a leafy character, then lemon zesty. Cleaning and refreshing, tasted at same time as Moor Southern Star.

Golden colour, small white creamy head. Aroma is fruits, wood, nectar and some earthyness. Flavour is quite much the same. Quite refreshing, even though a bit boring.

From cask at Brew Wharf. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is mild fruiy and sligh citrusy hoppy. Malty and slight peachy hoppy flavoured. Grapefruity bitter and dry. Smooth fruity and light peachy. Bitter, dry and fruity finish.
Cask-conditioned @ Brasserie 4:20....A metà strada tra lInghilterra ed il Belgio, una Golden Ale assolutamente godibile e beverina (anche troppo :)) ), fantastica la luppolatura che emerge al naso!

Cask-conditioned at the Bag ONails, Bristol 12/04/10. Deep, inviting gold in colour with a decent, lacy white head. Hoppy aroma of pineapple, grapefruit and lychee balanced by some sweet malts.
